SENT.plain: Human telomerase hTERC RNA serves as a template for the catalytic hTERT protein to synthesize telomere repeats at chromosome ends
We have recently shown that some patients with bone marrow failure syndromes are heterozygous carriers for hTERC or hTERT mutations
These sequence variations usually lead to a compromised telomerase function by haploinsufficiency

Here, we provide functional characterization of an additional 8 distinct hTERT sequence variants and 5 hTERC variants that have recently been identified in patients with dyskeratosis congenita (DC) or aplastic anemia (AA)
Among the mutations, 2 are novel telomerase variants that were identified in our cohort of patients

Whereas most of the sequence variants modulate telomerase function by haploinsufficiency, 2 hTERC variants with sequence changes located within the template region appear to act in a dominant-negative fashion

Inherited telomerase gene mutations, therefore, operate by various mechanisms to shorten telomere lengths, leading to limited marrow stem cell reserve and renewal capacity in patients with hematologic disorders
